doc.field: Series V: Cassette Tapes and Floppy Disks
Series V: Cassette Tapes and Floppy Disks

Contains cassette tapes with copies of Crossing Wall Street, Fitch's show on WBAI-FM, as well as interviews with rank and file labor union members. The cassettes containing interviews appear to be copies of interviews conducted by Jane LaTour in her capacity as archivist of the Burton Hall Papers, and are available at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives in the Burton Hall Union Democracy Oral History Project (OH 34). Two unlabeled 3.5 inch floppy disks are also part of this series.
Access [DVDs/ CDs / terminal] for audiovisual materials in the collection are available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only.

An access terminal for born-digital materials in the collection is available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Researchers may view an item's original container and/or carrier, but the physical carriers themselves are not available for use because of preservation concerns.
